explanation: add_response_entry_n — add_response_entry directly calls add_response_entry_n. To determine whether add_response_entry violates the MISRA rule against (direct or indirect) self-calls, the body of add_response_entry_n must be inspected to confirm it does not call add_response_entry (or call other functions that eventually call back into add_response_entry). The static call graph shows no further callees from add_response_entry_n, but its implementation (and any function-pointer calls it may perform) is the only symbol required to prove absence of an indirect recursion cycle.
